labels.text: For this photorealist painting, completed after China’s successful Olympic bid in 2001, Wang Xingwei appropriated a Liu Heung Shing photograph of two students wounded during the Tiananmen Square incident. Wang replaced these figures with bleeding penguins, an animal that has no significance in Chinese culture and is not native to the country. The absurdity of inserting these creatures into a loaded historical image, paired with the title of the work, can be seen as a sly response to China’s launch of a new identity in anticipation of global attention during the 2008 Olympics. Wang is known for embracing chaos and unsettlement in his practice. Though trained in the traditional socialist realism style, he employs a range of painting techniques and compositions to address contemporary social conditions and his personal history.

這幅照片現實主義油畫是在2001年中國成功申辦奧運之後完成的。作品構圖仿照劉香成在「天安門事件」期間所拍攝的搶救兩名受傷學生的照片，但王興偉將照片中的學生換成兩隻淌血的企鵝。企鵝在中國文化中並無特殊意義，也並非中國原生物種。王氏在歷史圖片裡加插「毫無意義」的動物，從而營造荒謬感，再配合作品名稱《新北京》，可解讀成對中國透過2008年奧運會力圖建立全新身分、渴望受到國際注目的巧妙而耐人尋味之回應。王興偉的藝術實踐擁抱混亂和不安，雖然他曾經接受傳統社會現實主義繪畫訓練，但作品採用多種技巧及構圖方式，訴說社會現狀和個人歷史。

images.AltText: Oil painting on canvas, based on the photograph 1989 Beijing, Sent Wounded Students on Tian'anmen Square to Hospital by Liu Heung-Shing. The two injured students on the back of a moving cargo bicycle have been replaced by bleeding penguins.
images.AltTextTC: 油彩布本作品以劉香成的攝影作品《1989年北京，送受傷的學生去醫院》為基礎，躺在三輪車後的兩個受傷學生，在畫中被改成兩隻淌血的企鵝。
